meanings.definition: A person who engages in petty or underhanded legal practices.
meanings.sent1: The pettifogger tried to manipulate the legal system for personal gain.
meanings.sent2: The courtroom was filled with pettifoggers looking to exploit loopholes.
meanings.sent3: The pettifogger's sneaky tactics were no match for the honest lawyer.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the pettifogger's cunning ways in the legal world.
meanings.sent5: The image of the pettifogger stuck in the minds of the jury.

meanings.definition: To argue or quibble over insignificant details.
meanings.sent1: Stop pettifogging and focus on the main issue at hand.
meanings.sent2: He tends to pettifogger instead of addressing the real problem.
meanings.sent3: The siblings would pettifogger over who should do the dishes.
meanings.sent4: Don't waste time pettifogging when we have important matters to discuss.
meanings.sent5: Her constant pettifogging annoyed everyone in the meeting.

meanings.definition: To act in a deceitful or unethical manner.
meanings.sent1: She decided to pettifogger her way out of trouble.
meanings.sent2: The politician was known to pettifogger to win votes.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to pettifogger his teacher with a fake excuse.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to pettifogger the company's policies was quickly discovered.
meanings.sent5: The pettifogger's lies eventually caught up with him.
